effect.name: Audio Spectrum Filter
effect.description: An audio visualization filter that draws an audio spectrum on the image.
effect.author: Brian Matherly

parameter.name: type
Graph type
parameter.comment: The type of graph to display the spectrum.

parameter.name: bgcolor
Background Color
parameter.comment: The background color to be applied to the entire frame. The default color is transparent.

parameter.name: thickness
Line Thickness
parameter.comment: The thickness of the line used to draw the waveform for line graph. The thickness of the bar for bar graph.

parameter.name: angle
Angle
parameter.comment: The rotation angle to be applied to the waveform.

parameter.name: rect
Rectangle
parameter.comment: Defines the rectangle that the waveform(s) should be drawn in.

parameter.name: fill
Fill
parameter.comment: Whether the area under the waveform should be filled in. Only applies to line graph type.

parameter.name: mirror
Mirror
parameter.comment: Mirror the spectrum about the center of the rectangle.

parameter.name: reverse
Reverse
parameter.comment: Draw the points starting with the highest frequency first.

parameter.name: tension
Line Tension
parameter.comment: Affects the amount of curve in the line interpolating between points. 0.0 = a straight line between points. 100 = very curved lines between points. Values < 0 and > 100 will cause loops in the lines. Only applies to line graph type.

parameter.name: bands
Points
parameter.comment: The number of bands to draw in the spectrum. Each band shows up as a data point in the graph.

parameter.name: frequency_low
Low Frequency
parameter.comment: The low end of the frequency range to be used for the graph.

parameter.name: frequency_high
High Frequency
parameter.comment: The high end of the frequency range to be used for the graph.

parameter.name: threshold
Level Threshold
parameter.comment: The minimum amplitude of sound that must occur within the frequency range to cause the value to be applied.

parameter.name: window_size
Window Size
parameter.comment: The number of samples that the FFT will be performed on. If window size is less than the number of samples in a frame, extra samples will be ignored. If window size is more than the number of samples in a frame, samples will be buffered from previous frames to fill the window. The buffering is performed as a sliding window so that the most recent samples are always transformed.
